text: John J. Cornwell was an American Democratic Party politician who served as governor of West Virginia from 1917 to 1921. A supporter of progressive measures like workmen’s compensation and an eight-hour day,The Americanization of West Virginia Creating a Modern Industrial State, 1916-1925 By John C. Hennen, 2021 Cornwell’s time as governor witnessed the passage of a wide range of reformsActs of the Legislature of West Virginia 1919 in areas such as working conditions.West Virginia A History By Otis K. Rice, Otis Rice, Stephen W. Brown, 2010, P.217 Title: Labor Legislation of 1919 : Bulletin of the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics, No. 277, P.337-346 ==References== Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: John J. Cornwell
